final_answer:
The humor and satire in the image stem from the juxtaposition of the two scenes. On the left, a woman is dedicatedly exercising on a treadmill, emphasizing the goal of fitness and physical exertion. On the right, another woman dressed in workout clothes chooses to take the elevator instead of the stairs to reach the gym.

This contrast highlights the irony of someone going to a place dedicated to exercise yet opting for a more convenient and less physically taxing option (the elevator) over the stairs, which would align more with the fitness goals one might expect. The image humorously comments on human tendencies to seek convenience, even in contexts where exertion is the objective.
ground_truth: The image is ironic, because in the left image a woman is seen using the stair climber machine at the gym but the same woman is not ready to climb up some stairs for going to the gym and is calling for the lift
